title: Create the Gapminder dataset
text:
# Import necessary libraries
import pandas as pd
from gapminder import gapminder

# Rename 'lifeExp' to 'life_expectancy' and 'gdpPercap' to 'gdp_per_capita'
gapminder = gapminder.rename(columns={'lifeExp': 'life_expectancy',
                                      'pop': 'population_millions', 
                                      'gdpPercap': 'gdp_per_capita'})

# Convert population to millions
gapminder['population_millions'] = gapminder['population_millions'] / 1_000_000

# Create a new pandas DataFrame from the modified gapminder data
gapminder_df = pd.DataFrame(gapminder)

# Save the DataFrame as a CSV file
gapminder_df.to_csv('gapminder.csv', index=False)

# Print the first 3 rows of the DataFrame
print(gapminder_df.head(3))

       country continent  year  life_expectancy  population_millions  \
0  Afghanistan      Asia  1952           28.801             8.425333   
1  Afghanistan      Asia  1957           30.332             9.240934   
2  Afghanistan      Asia  1962           31.997            10.267083   

   gdp_per_capita  
0      779.445314  
1      820.853030  
2      853.100710

title: Changes in Life Expectancy and Other Indicators Over Time
text:
Life Expectancy Comparison
Here, we investigate how the life expectancy and other indicators in India change over time.

# Import necessary libraries
import pandas as pd
from gapminder import gapminder
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Rename 'lifeExp' to 'life_expectancy' and 'gdpPercap' to 'gdp_per_capita'
gapminder = gapminder.rename(columns={'lifeExp': 'life_expectancy',
                                      'pop': 'population_millions', 
                                      'gdpPercap': 'gdp_per_capita'})

# Convert population to millions
gapminder['population_millions'] = gapminder['population_millions'] / 1_000_000

# Create a new pandas DataFrame from the modified gapminder data
gapminder_df = pd.DataFrame(gapminder)

# Filter the dataset for only datapoints from India
indiaData = gapminder_df[gapminder_df['country'] == 'India']

plt.plot(indiaData['year'], indiaData['life_expectancy'], linestyle='dashed', marker='o')

plt.xlabel("Year")
plt.ylabel("Life Expectancy")
plt.title("Life Expectancy over Time")

plt.show()

plt.plot(indiaData['year'], indiaData['gdp_per_capita'], linestyle='dashed', marker='o')

plt.xlabel("Year")
plt.ylabel("GDP per Capita")
plt.title("GDP per Capita over Time")

plt.show()

plt.plot(indiaData['year'], indiaData['population_millions'], linestyle='dashed', marker='o')

plt.xlabel("Year")
plt.ylabel("Population (in millions)")
plt.title("Population over Time")

plt.show()

title: Life Expectancy and Population Comparison
text:
Life Expectancy and Population Comparison
Here, we investigate whether there is a documented link between the life expectancy in a country and the country’s population.

# Import necessary libraries
import pandas as pd
from gapminder import gapminder
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Rename 'lifeExp' to 'life_expectancy' and 'gdpPercap' to 'gdp_per_capita'
gapminder = gapminder.rename(columns={'lifeExp': 'life_expectancy',
                                      'pop': 'population_millions', 
                                      'gdpPercap': 'gdp_per_capita'})

# Convert population to millions
gapminder['population_millions'] = gapminder['population_millions'] / 1_000_000

# Create a new pandas DataFrame from the modified gapminder data
gapminder_df = pd.DataFrame(gapminder)

plt.scatter(gapminder_df['life_expectancy'], gapminder_df['population_millions'])

plt.xlabel("Life Expectancy")
plt.ylabel("Population")
plt.title("Life Expectancy vs Population")

plt.show()

title: Gapminder Quiz
text:
The Gapminder dataset contains data about 142 different countries recorded over a 55 year span; the columns include country, continent, year, life expectancy, poulation and GDP per capita.
This website contains a comparison between Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita
This website also contains a comparison between Life Expectancy and Population
Finally, there is a page tracking several indicators measured in India over time at Country Analysis

title: Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita Comparison
text:
Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita Comparison
Here, we investigate whether there is a documented link between the life expectancy in a country and the country’s GDP per capita.

# Import necessary libraries
import pandas as pd
from gapminder import gapminder
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Rename 'lifeExp' to 'life_expectancy' and 'gdpPercap' to 'gdp_per_capita'
gapminder = gapminder.rename(columns={'lifeExp': 'life_expectancy',
                                      'pop': 'population_millions', 
                                      'gdpPercap': 'gdp_per_capita'})

# Convert population to millions
gapminder['population_millions'] = gapminder['population_millions'] / 1_000_000

# Create a new pandas DataFrame from the modified gapminder data
gapminder_df = pd.DataFrame(gapminder)

plt.scatter(gapminder_df['life_expectancy'], gapminder_df['gdp_per_capita'])

plt.xlabel("Life Expectancy")
plt.ylabel("GDP per Capita")
plt.title("Life Expectancy vs GDP per Capita")

plt.show()

title: Changes in Life Expectancy and Other Indicators Over Time
text:
Life Expectancy Comparison
Here, we investigate how the life expectancy and other indicators in India change over time.

# Import necessary libraries
import pandas as pd
from gapminder import gapminder
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Rename 'lifeExp' to 'life_expectancy' and 'gdpPercap' to 'gdp_per_capita'
gapminder = gapminder.rename(columns={'lifeExp': 'life_expectancy',
                                      'pop': 'population_millions', 
                                      'gdpPercap': 'gdp_per_capita'})

# Convert population to millions
gapminder['population_millions'] = gapminder['population_millions'] / 1_000_000

# Create a new pandas DataFrame from the modified gapminder data
gapminder_df = pd.DataFrame(gapminder)

# Filter the dataset for only datapoints from India
indiaData = gapminder_df[gapminder_df['country'] == 'India']

plt.plot(indiaData['year'], indiaData['life_expectancy'], linestyle='dashed', marker='o')

plt.xlabel("Year")
plt.ylabel("Life Expectancy")
plt.title("Life Expectancy over Time")

plt.show()

plt.plot(indiaData['year'], indiaData['gdp_per_capita'], linestyle='dashed', marker='o')

plt.xlabel("Year")
plt.ylabel("GDP per Capita")
plt.title("GDP per Capita over Time")

plt.show()

plt.plot(indiaData['year'], indiaData['population_millions'], linestyle='dashed', marker='o')

plt.xlabel("Year")
plt.ylabel("Population (in millions)")
plt.title("Population over Time")

plt.show()

title: Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita Comparison
text:
Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita Comparison
Here, we investigate whether there is a documented link between the life expectancy in a country and the country’s GDP per capita.

# Import necessary libraries
import pandas as pd
from gapminder import gapminder
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Rename 'lifeExp' to 'life_expectancy' and 'gdpPercap' to 'gdp_per_capita'
gapminder = gapminder.rename(columns={'lifeExp': 'life_expectancy',
                                      'pop': 'population_millions', 
                                      'gdpPercap': 'gdp_per_capita'})

# Convert population to millions
gapminder['population_millions'] = gapminder['population_millions'] / 1_000_000

# Create a new pandas DataFrame from the modified gapminder data
gapminder_df = pd.DataFrame(gapminder)

plt.scatter(gapminder_df['life_expectancy'], gapminder_df['gdp_per_capita'])

plt.xlabel("Life Expectancy")
plt.ylabel("GDP per Capita")
plt.title("Life Expectancy vs GDP per Capita")

plt.show()
